1800/A0/06/001/001.status_value: UNICEF supported the development of a new Juvenile Justice Bill ¿ which complies with the Bejing rules minimum standards. 1800/A0/06/001/005.status_value: UNICEF is supporting the revision of legislation on violence against children  so that it can be aligned with CRC norms.  It is meanwhile supporting implementation of certain aspects of current legislation so to ensure it can be adequately implemented (e.g youth court  and special sexual offense court)
1800/A0/06/001/005.indicator_name: "Key articles of the CRC (Art 19  Art 34 and Art 38   Optional Protocol on the sale of children  child prostitution and child pornography and  Optional Protocol on the involvement of children in armed conflict) dealing with violence  exploitation and abuse have been domesticated into national legislation "

1800/A0/05/001/001.status_value: Capacity building was conducted through  MICS data processing  data analysis  interpretation and dissemination and GuyD_Info utilisation and ToT workshops. Consensus reachd on a 2nd generation  needs based comprehensive capacity strengthening plan
1800/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: Bureau of Statistics has the capacity to collect statistical data disaggregated (by sex  age  region  ethnicity  income ) on key indicators for children and women
1800/A0/05/001/001.headline: MICS 5 and the Situation Analysis of Women and Children in Guyana were launched in 2016  and provide important information the country will use to make future plans
1800/A0/05/001/001.baseline_value: Gaps in statistical standards  tools and technical capacity

1800/A0/05/001/001.status_value: The final report for Guyana population and housing Census was expected to be published in 2014 but is now scheduled to be published by the end of 2015. The preliminary Census report  was published in June of this year
1800/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: GuyD_Info database having up to date available disaggregated(by sex  age  region  ethnicity  income) data on key indicators for children and women
1800/A0/05/001/001.headline: MICS 5 and the Situation Analysis of Women and Children in Guyana were launched in 2016  and provide important information the country will use to make future plans

1800/A0/05/001/001.status_value: The Demographic and Health Survey comes to the five-year age at the end of 2014  when the key findings report for the MICS is be being finalised
1800/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: National household survey or DHS or MICS providing key indicators on the situation of women and children conducted at least every 3 years
1800/A0/05/001/001.headline: MICS 5 and the Situation Analysis of Women and Children in Guyana were launched in 2016  and provide important information the country will use to make future plans

1800/A0/05/001/001.status_value: The RFAFC finalised and a monitoring system  which is extendable  was established and operationalized. Classification for Outcome level indicators should be reflected in the CARICOM DevInfo database currently being compiled. Indicator dropped at the MTR.
1800/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: Guyana Children's Rights Monitoring System providing data for Caribbean sub-regional M&E system.
1800/A0/05/001/001.headline: MICS 5 and the Situation Analysis of Women and Children in Guyana were launched in 2016  and provide important information the country will use to make future plans

1800/A0/05/001/001.status_value: Fieldwork  data entry and processing have been completed in the implementation of MICS 5. The key findings report was finalised  Dec 2014 and will be published in Jan 2015. The final report is expected to be completed and published by March 2015
1800/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: MICS 5 providing disaggregated data on child rights (survival  education  protection  participation) indicators
1800/A0/05/001/001.headline: MICS 5 and the Situation Analysis of Women and Children in Guyana were launched in 2016  and provide important information the country will use to make future plans
1800/A0/05/001/001.baseline_value: MICS3 2006 report provides data on key indicators  mostly disaggregated.

1800/A0/05/001/001.status_value: The statutory report for RCC  will be submitted in 2015. However  this will now be constrained due to the Parliamentary suspension
1800/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: Guyana Rights of the Child Commission issuing annual status report and recommendations  compliant with the CRC and its optional protocols
1800/A0/05/001/001.headline: MICS 5 and the Situation Analysis of Women and Children in Guyana were launched in 2016  and provide important information the country will use to make future plans
1800/A0/05/001/001.baseline_value: No monitoring system in place  no annual report available

1800/A0/05/001/001.status_value: The final report on the Situation Analysis on children and women was finalized and approved in August 2016

1800/A0/05/001/001.status_value: Progress has been made in determining the next steps and hiring a consultant. The action plan will be developed in 2015 with the support of line Ministries.
1800/A0/05/001/001.indicator_name: Plan of Action to implement CRC and CEDAW recommendations and recommendation of the UN Study on violence against children completed and under implementation

1800/A0/05/001/004.status_value: Sitan on children and women completed
1800/A0/05/001/004.indicator_name: Availability of updated data and analysis on children and women
1800/A0/05/001/004.headline: The Situation Analysis of Children and Women in Suriname was conducted in a very inclusive manner and provided room for important discussions on the way forward  while the advocacy and capacity development around Multi-Dimensional Child Poverty Measurement impacted the way forward in setting the poverty line in Suriname.

1800/A0/05/001/004.status_value: Database has been updated with all 3 publications and yearbook GBS. Suriname Censusinfo was also updated with Census 2012 data. Both databases (Surinfo and Suriname Censusinfo) were launched
1800/A0/05/001/004.indicator_name: Suri_Info database having up to date available disaggregated data on key indicators for children and women  including on SRH an gender
1800/A0/05/001/004.headline: The Situation Analysis of Children and Women in Suriname was conducted in a very inclusive manner and provided room for important discussions on the way forward  while the advocacy and capacity development around Multi-Dimensional Child Poverty Measurement impacted the way forward in setting the poverty line in Suriname.

1800/A0/05/001/004.status_value: Surinfo including Suriname Censusinfo included indicators with disaggregated data as much as possible

1800/A0/05/001/004.baseline_value: Preliminary discussion on Census have started

1800/A0/05/001/005.status_value: CFS budgetting analysis is discussed during the AWP 2015 preperation meeting. MINOV stakeholders are interested and want to have more information.
1800/A0/05/001/005.indicator_name: Availability of a Child friendly budget analysis study and status of implementation of recommendations
1800/A0/05/001/005.headline: The evaluation of the "I believe in You' programme is key to the revision of the approach in Suriname  while the on-going Out of School Children assessment will provide evidence on reasons for high drop-outs in the country which will inform future programming.

1800/A0/05/001/005.status_value: Study on implementation of ICT4E initiatives completed and disseminated. UNICEF provided technical support to the establishment of ICT in Education Unit . CAL working group in process to be formalized into ICT in Education Platform.
1800/A0/05/001/005.indicator_name: Availability of Education policy/framework  including ICT4Education
1800/A0/05/001/005.headline: The evaluation of the "I believe in You' programme is key to the revision of the approach in Suriname  while the on-going Out of School Children assessment will provide evidence on reasons for high drop-outs in the country which will inform future programming.

1800/A0/05/001/005.status_value: No new education data produced by the MoE. The quality of school mapping in 2013 is not satisfied for publication. Assessment of R&P department conducted  but did not result with clear action plan.
1800/A0/05/001/005.indicator_name: Availability of disaggregated data on key indicators from EMISS database
1800/A0/05/001/005.headline: The evaluation of the "I believe in You' programme is key to the revision of the approach in Suriname  while the on-going Out of School Children assessment will provide evidence on reasons for high drop-outs in the country which will inform future programming.
